disambiguated_text: LADAR systems may generally be grouped into three main categories: pulsed LADAR, in which the illuminating laser is pulsed and the detector records time-of-flight; amplitude modulated (AM) LADAR, in which the amplitude of the illuminating beam is sinusoidally modulated and the detector records phase of return amplitude modulation; and frequency modulated (FM) LADAR, in which the frequency and/or phase of the laser illumination is modulated, and the detector records the relative optical phase of the return signal.
